data.title: Cozy restaurant downtown Ames with a cool menu
data.text: Went here for lunch with the family on move-in day for ISU. Fantastic!  The menu was great with many options but not overwhelming. Burgers got a thumbs up from the family and my "Love at first bite" was amazing.  The steak sandwich (which I did taste) was done perfectly and had such great flavor. Met the owner on our way out and he was so friendly. We'll definitely be returning.

data.title: Wonderful Food
data.text: When in Ames, we always try to have dinner at Aunt Maude's. Excellent menu, fine service, well-rounded wine list. Aunt Maude's is definitely where we will choose to eat if we are in Ames. Iowa is noted for its tri-tip steaks and Aunt Maude's has several offerings of this excellent cut of Iowa beef.

data.title: Expensive - Liked the option to order a smaller serving of main offerings
data.text: I chose the smaller serving of salmon, and was not disappointed. No salad comes with the meal, just vegetables.  You can order a salad for $4.00 with your meal.  I liked that atmosphere in the dining room, and wait staff was professional.  If you want a casual evening, you can also eat in the bar if a booth is open, or outside in warm weather.  My husband did not like his steak - New York Strip.  If you plan to go check out the menu on line, and also call for reservations.

data.title: Very well
data.text: Was my second time in this restaurant. Good service, we went there to celebrate a birthday was all perfect except two dishes but they did their best to solve it. Good chocolate mouse and variety of drinks. I ate the grill salmon was very well, I like their option to order smaller platers

data.title: Business Dinner
data.text:
Our company had a large (35) group travel to Ames while touring company facilities.  The setting was warm and the wait staff was fast and courteous.
Try the Peanut Butter Pie!

data.title: Aunt Maude's
data.text:
에임스시내 다운타운에 위치한 Aunt Maude's는 신선한 현지 재료를 사용함으로써 계절마다 메뉴를 변화시킨다고 합니다.
Lunch Hours: 
 Monday-Friday 11 AM – 2 PM 
 Closed for Lunch Saturday 
Dinner Hours: 
 Monday-Saturday 
 Beginning at 5 PM 
 Lounge Open Daily at 4 PM 
 Closed Sundays

data.title: One of the Best
data.text: Maude's has been a stable for about 30 years in Ames. It is not inexpensive but every dish on the menu is a bounty of flavors. One of our favorites is the Cajun Prime Rib sandwich, which is also one of the least expensive. It is great every time. Their Tequila Chicken Fettuccini is awesome and they offer bistro servings of it and several dishes for those folks that prefer smaller portions. Never disappointed here. If you want to sit in the dining room a call ahead would be advised but if you are comfortable in the bar (and it is a VERY comfortable bar room) you rarely have to wait. Don't go if you are afraid to spend $20 to $40 per person, but otherwise you won't be disappointed.

data.title: One of the Top Restaurants in AMes Iowa
data.text:
The Chef and staff are so professional and the food is always top notch.
The menu is so wonderful From Steak to Pasta to sea foods and vegetarian.
The atmosphere is wonderful and very inviting. The have wonderful unusual Chef specials that  are so good. The full bar is very high end and they even have old fashion
Ice cream drinks Brandy Alexander's, pink Squirrel's, Grasshoppers. They are beautiful and delicious. My husband takes me there every year on our Anniversary.
And severl times a year. Yum

data.title: Love the chocolate mousse
data.text: Aunt Maudes is a slightly upscale restaurant in Ames  that boasts the food is local or sourced locally ... They offer a great choice of starters, main courses and desserts that change on a regular basis ... I love their salmon, the steak sandwich is awesome .. And there are many other choices ... You really can't go wrong  ... For dessert I. Love their chocolate mousse ... Best ever !!! The peanut butter pie is a close second ... For ambiance and a great evening ... Put this one on your list ...

data.title: Good food - a bit pricey
data.text: Great place to eat, but bring your pocketbook. The quiche at noon is really good.  Great atmosphere and a very popular place just off Main in Ames.

data.title: Haute Cusine
data.text: Fine dining at its best, offering many traditional and continential specialties. The Chef and waitstaff are impeccably ready to serve you and your party the finest meal that can be had in the entire county.

data.title: Great spot for a quiet dinner or fun lunch!
data.text: We have enjoyed many lunches and evening cocktails!  We are treated as special guests when we walk in the door and throughout our meal!  The selections are great with specials to allow new things to try!

data.title: Worth the Stop
data.text: While on our road trip, my Brother and I decided to make our stop and check out a restaurant in the historic downtown area.  Neat interior with stained glass and an old fashioned dark wood bar.  We had very fast service with our food brought in eight minutes (faster than some fast food places!) - we happened to notice the time as we were on a schedule.  I had the steak sandwich.  It was the best I have had.  The medium rare medallions of beef were very tender.

data.title: Great place for lunch.
data.text: Great place for lunch. I love the Blackened Chicken and Angel hair pasta! The bread and salad that come with it are amazing.

data.title: Good place for lunch
data.text: The lunch menu is very good. The evening menu is pricey, but very good. I would not recommend bringing children in the evening.  I love the French Dip sandwich, it has never disappointed me. The servers are knowledgeable about the items on the menu, and the dessert items are freshly made.

data.title: Food is always special
data.text: We have never had a bad meal at Aunt Maude's. It is always a place to go for a celebration.  Love the Scallops!!!

data.title: Unique and special
data.text: Three of us had dinner here once before and never disappointed. Great menu. Not run of the mill food. Very pleasant atmosphere and fine dining. Staff friendly and helpful. Delicious food and drinks. Indoor and outdoor sitting. Lovely decor.

data.title: One of the best in Ames!
data.text: The chili rubbed filet and prime rib are always fantastic, but come at a very upscale price. The salmon is another favorite and many other entrees vary. The New Orleans BBQed shrimp are very good and different. The signature peanut butter pie is excellent and should not be missed.

data.title: Never cared for this restaurant
data.text: This place has a problem, they care moe about atmosphere and presentation of the food than the quality of the food or giving good service. It has been around along time with different. Owners, but hasn't changed.

data.title: Good food, dim lighting
data.text: Aunt Maude's is one of the best date night restaurants in town. Good food, a little pricey, but very dim lighting.
